What are some of the unique capabilities of Verus PBaaS, and how do they enable new possibilities for decentralized applications and crypto users?

Verus PBaaS offers several capabilities that go beyond what is currently possible on other decentralized platforms. Two of these capabilities are particularly noteworthy: Self-sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (VerusID) and Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault).

**VerusID:**
VerusID enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. This means that users have complete control over their identities and funds, and can revoke or recover them as needed. VerusID is a protocol that can be implemented on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network, allowing for seamless and secure management of identities and funds.

**Verus Vault:**
Verus Vault is a staking-capable time locking and theft prevention mechanism that enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. This feature allows users to specify an unlock delay, which can be set to a sufficient amount of time to notice if someone has compromised their keys. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Additionally, users can choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID, making it virtually theft-proof. This feature enables solutions to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft.

These capabilities, among others, make Verus PBaaS a powerful platform for building decentralized applications and enabling new use cases in the crypto space.
